Finnish: Oma maa mansikka, muu maa mustikka.
English: Literally: Own country strawberry, other country blueberry. (Things are better at home.)
Literally: It costs strawberries. (It's really expensive.)
Literally: They are like two berries. (They're very similar, like two peas in a pod.)
Literally: He went picking berries with the gentlemen. (He trusts unsubstantiated promises.)
Literally: It was the cherry on top of the cake. (It was the highpoint, the thing that made it perfect.)
Hungarian: Ez volt a hab a tortán.
